section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: agreed booking fee (協定預約費用), in relation to an arrangement to hire a fleet taxi for a pre-arranged journey that is not an agreed fare arrangement, means any booking fee agreed between the fleet licensee that operates the taxi and the hirer in advance of the journey; (34 of 2023 s. 14)

agreed fare (協定車費), in relation to an arrangement to hire a fleet taxi for a pre-arranged journey, means the fare for the hire agreed between the fleet licensee that operates the taxi and the hirer in advance of the journey; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
authorized person (獲授權人) means any employee of a passenger service licensee or fleet licensee on duty on or in connection with a vehicle; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
chargeable amount (應收款額) means the amount of fares chargeable under Schedule 5, but does not include any amount chargeable under item 4 of that Schedule; (L.N. 219 of 2008)
cross-harbour taxi stand (過海的士站) means a taxi stand designated as a cross-harbour taxi stand under regulation 30; (L.N. 236 of 1995)
electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 196 of 2022)
fleet licensee (車隊持牌人) means the holder of a taxi fleet licence; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
fleet taxi certificate (車隊的士證明書) means a certificate issued under regulation 12N; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
fleet taxi stopping place (車隊的士停車處) means an area of road designated under regulation 30A(1) or 31(d); (34 of 2023 s. 14)
general taxi (一般的士) means a taxi that is not a fleet taxi; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
Lantau Link (青嶼幹線) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Tsing Ma Control Area Ordinance (Cap. 498); (L.N. 61 of 2017)

parking (泊車、停泊), subject to subregulation (2), means the standing of a vehicle, whether occupied or not, except when standing temporarily for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading or picking up or setting down passengers;
passenger service licensee (客運持證人) means the holder of a passenger service licence; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
pre-arranged journey (預定行程), in relation to a fleet taxi, means a journey in the taxi that is arranged in advance by booking through electronic means or telephone; (34 of 2023 s. 14)
printing (打印) includes any electronic or mechanical mode of representing words in a visible form; (L.N. 149 of 1997)
printout (列印本) includes a copy of a printout; (L.N. 196 of 2022)
public light bus stand (公共小巴站) means an area of road designated as a public light bus stand under regulation 29 or 31;
public light bus stopping place (公共小巴停車處) means an area of road designated as a public light bus stopping place under regulation 28 or 31;

receipt printing device (收據打印設備), in relation to a taxi, means the device installed in respect of the taxi in accordance with regulation 42A of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A); (L.N. 149 of 1997)
scheduled service (專綫服務) means a service of one or more vehicles authorized under a passenger service licence and limited by the conditions of such licence to specified routes;

taxi fleet licence (的士車隊牌照) means a licence issued under regulation 12E(1) and includes—(a)if the licence is amended under regulation 12I or 12J—the amended licence issued under regulation 12L(3)(a); and(b)if the licence is varied under regulation 12X(1)(c)—the varied licence issued under regulation 12L(3)(d); (34 of 2023 s. 14)
taxi stand (的士站) means an area of road designated as a taxi stand under regulation 30 or 31.

Notwithstanding the definition of parking (泊車、停泊) in subregulation (1), a vehicle shall be deemed not to be parked for the purposes of these regulations where it is prevented from proceeding by breakdown or other circumstances beyond the driver’s control, and all reasonable steps are taken to minimize any obstruction and effect the removal of the vehicle as soon as possible.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: These regulations shall not apply to a public bus operated under a franchise granted under the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230).

subsection.content: A person proposing to operate a public bus service, a private bus service, a public light bus service or a school private light bus service within the meaning of section 27 of the Ordinance may at any time deliver to the Commissioner an application for a passenger service licence in accordance with these regulations. (50 of 1999 s. 13)

Where the Commissioner considers it desirable to introduce a service referred to in subregulation (1) he may by notice in the Gazette or in such other manner as he thinks fit, invite applications for a passenger service licence under subregulation (1).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Form and contents of application
section.leadIn: An application under regulation 4 shall be in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall set out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the type of service proposed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the route or area to be served;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number and type of vehicles to be operated on the service;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the maintenance facilities proposed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the staff to be employed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the frequency at and the period on each day during which the service shall be operated;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: proposed fares (if any); and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: such other particulars as the Commissioner may require.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Period of passenger service licence
section.content: A passenger service licence may be issued for a period not exceeding 5 years and may be extended by the Commissioner for a further period or periods each of not more than 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: A passenger service licence shall be in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall set out— (L.N. 91 of 2015)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its date of commencement and expiry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the passenger service licence number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the passenger service licensee; (34 of 2023 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the service or services in respect of which the passenger service licence is issued;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the registration marks of the vehicles to be operated under the passenger service licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any conditions specified under section 29 of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any exemptions specified under regulation 9;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the fee payable under regulation 10 and the date upon which such fee is payable; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: such other particulars as the Commissioner deems necessary.

subsection.leadIn: Subregulation (1)(h) does not apply to a licence that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is issued on or after 1 September 2015; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorizes the holder of the licence to operate a school private light bus service. (L.N. 91 of 2015)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, after consultation with a passenger service licensee, by giving 3 months’ notice in writing to the licensee, either personally or by registered post, amend the terms or conditions of a passenger service licence at any time during its validity, whether by way of expansion, variation or curtailment of the service or services provided for, or otherwise. (L.N. 185 of 1988; 34 of 2023 s. 2)

Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subregulation (1) may, within 14 days after the notification under subregulation (1), apply in writing to the Commissioner for a review of the decision by a Transport Tribunal, and that decision shall not take effect pending the outcome of the review. (L.N. 185 of 1988)
Regulations 55A and 55B shall apply to an application made under subregulation (2). (L.N. 185 of 1988)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Exemption of passenger service licensee from regulations
section.content: The Commissioner may, in his discretion, exempt a passenger service licensee from the requirements of any provision of these regulations specified in the passenger service licence, subject to the conditions (if any) specified in such licence.

subsection.content: This regulation applies to a passenger service licence other than one that authorizes its holder to operate a school private light bus service.
A fee specified in Part A of Schedule 1 is payable for a passenger service licence.
The fee is payable on the date specified in the licence.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Licence to be delivered on cancellation, etc.

subsection.content: Where a passenger service licence is cancelled, suspended or varied under section 31 or 35 of the Ordinance, or amended under regulation 8, the passenger service licensee shall, within 72 hours after such cancellation, suspension, variation or amendment comes into effect, deliver the passenger service licence to the Commissioner. (L.N. 185 of 1988; 34 of 2023 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where a passenger service licence is delivered under subregulation (1) the Commissioner shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record the cancellation of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withhold; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend,

subsection.continued: the passenger service licence as the circumstances require.

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Issue of duplicate passenger service licence
section.content: Where a passenger service licence issued to a passenger service licensee is lost, defaced or destroyed, the Commissioner may, on payment of the appropriate fee specified in Part A of Schedule 1, issue a duplicate licence, which shall have the same force and effect as the original licence.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Passenger service licence certificates and plates

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application by a passenger service licensee; and (34 of 2023 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is not one that relates to a passenger service licence that authorizes its holder of the licence to operate a school private light bus service, on payment of the fee specified in Part B of Schedule 1,

subsection.continued: issue, in respect of a vehicle operated under a passenger service licence, a certificate, in the form specified by the Commissioner. (L.N. 91 of 2015)

subsection.content: A certificate issued under subregulation (1) shall be valid for a period of 12 months or until the expiry of the passenger service licence to which the certificate relates, whichever is the sooner, and shall not be transferable to another vehicle. (L.N. 51 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: Every vehicle operated under a passenger service licence shall display—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate issued under subregulation (1) on the left hand half of the vehicle’s windscreen in a manner as to be visible from the front of the vehicle; and (L.N. 185 of 1988)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the rear of the vehicle, a plate showing the passenger service licence number in accordance with Figure No. 2 of Schedule 2.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: For a certificate issued under subregulation (1) in respect of a vehicle that is issued in the form of an electronic record, while a proper printout of the e-certificate is displayed on the vehicle, the printout is deemed to be the original certificate. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall drive or use a vehicle operated under a passenger service licence or suffer or permit such a vehicle to be driven or used, if such vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not display the certificate and the plate referred to in subregulation (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: displays any such certificate or plate other than in the manner prescribed by subregulation (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: displays any certificate, printout or plate, purporting to be a certificate referred to in subregulation (3)(a), a printout referred to in subregulation (3A), or a plate referred to in subregulation (3)(b), that— (L.N. 196 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is damaged, altered or defaced;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: does not relate to the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: displays a certificate referred to in subregulation (3)(a), or a printout of an e-certificate, that is invalid. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

subsection.content: Where a certificate issued under subregulation (1) is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, the Commissioner may, on payment of the appropriate fee specified in Part B of Schedule 1, issue a duplicate certificate, and such certificate when issued shall be deemed to be a certificate issued under subregulation (1) and shall have the same force and effect as the original certificate. (L.N. 196 of 2022)
No fee payable under this regulation shall be refunded.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: proper printout (合規格列印本), in relation to an e-certificate, means a clearly legible printout of the e-certificate that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the conditions of the relevant passenger service licence. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: specified provision (指明條文) means a provision of any enactment that applies in relation to a fleet licensee or fleet taxi.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Commissioner may invite application for licence

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, invite applications for a licence to operate a taxi fleet.
The Commissioner may determine the maximum number of licences to be issued in respect of each invitation under subregulation (1).
A notice published under subregulation (1) is not subsidiary legislation.
A person who wishes to obtain a licence to operate a taxi fleet may, in response to an invitation under regulation 12B(1), apply to the Commissioner for such a licence.
The application must be made in the form specified by the Commissioner.
The Commissioner may grant or refuse an application made under regulation 12C.

subsection.leadIn: In determining the application, the Commissioner may take the following matters into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the demand for the services to be provided by the taxi fleet proposed to be operated by the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the level of services already provided by existing fleet licensees’ taxi fleets;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the standard of the services to be provided by the taxi fleet proposed to be operated by the applicant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other matters the Commissioner considers relevant to the regulation of the operation of taxis.

subsection.content: The Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision on the application to the applicant.
If the Commissioner refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the refusal.

If the Commissioner grants an application under regulation 12D(1), the Commissioner must, in respect of the taxis that the applicant proposes to operate as a taxi fleet, issue to the applicant a licence to operate the taxi fleet.
When issuing the licence, the Commissioner may impose on the licence any conditions the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subregulation (2), the conditions may relate to one or more of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the standard of the services provided by the taxi fleet operated under the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the keeping of records in relation to the services provided by the taxi fleet;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the submission to the Commissioner of returns and accounts in relation to the services provided by the taxi fleet;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the minimum number of taxis required to be operated in the taxi fleet;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the replacement of the taxis;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the illuminated signs, markings and painting of the taxis;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the drivers of the taxis.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must specify in the licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period within which the licence is valid (validity period);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period before the end of the validity period within which the licensee may apply for an extension of the validity period;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licence number;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the number of taxis in the taxi fleet operated under the licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the registration mark of each taxi in the taxi fleet;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: all conditions imposed under subregulation (2) (if any);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: all exemptions granted under regulation 12H (if any), including any conditions imposed on the exemptions;
the fee payable under regulation 12F(1) for the licence and the date on or before which the fee is payable; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any other particulars the Commissioner considers necessary.

subsection.content: A fee specified in Schedule 1A is payable for a taxi fleet licence.
The fee is payable on or before the date specified in the licence.

section.name: s12G
section.heading: Validity period of licence and its extension

subsection.content: A taxi fleet licence is valid for the validity period specified in the licence.
The validity period so specified must not exceed 5 years.

A fleet licensee may apply in writing to the Commissioner for an extension of the validity period of the licensee’s taxi fleet licence within the period specified in the licence for making such an application.
The Commissioner may grant or refuse the application.
The Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision on the application to the applicant.
If the Commissioner refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the refusal.
If the Commissioner grants the application, the Commissioner may extend the validity period for a further period not exceeding 5 years.
The validity period may be extended more than once.

section.name: s12H
section.heading: Exemption of licensee from specified provision

subsection.content: The Commissioner may exempt a fleet licensee from complying with any specified provision.
When granting an exemption, the Commissioner may impose on the exemption any conditions the Commissioner considers appropriate.

section.name: s12I
section.heading: Amendment of licence on Commissioner’s own initiative

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on the Commissioner’s own initiative, amend a taxi fleet licence at any time during the validity period specified in the licence.
However, before exercising the power under subregulation (1), the Commissioner must consult the fleet licensee concerned on the amendment the Commissioner proposes to make (proposed amendment).

subsection.leadIn: After the end of the period for the consultation, the Commissioner may decide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to exercise the power under subregulation (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to exercise the power to—

subparagraph.content: make the proposed amendment; or
vary the proposed amendment in the manner the Commissioner considers appropriate and make the proposed amendment as varied.

subsection.leadIn: For subregulation (3), the period for the consultation ends on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licensee gives written notice of the licensee’s agreement to the proposed amendment to the Commissioner within the period of 3 months beginning on the date on which the consultation begins—the date of the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the date of expiry of the 3-month period referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision made under subregulation (3) to the licensee.
A written notice of the Commissioner’s decision made under subregulation (3)(b) must include a statement of the reasons for the decision.
Subject to subregulation (8) and regulation 12Y(4), the Commissioner’s decision under subregulation (3)(b) takes effect on the date specified by the Commissioner in the notice.
The date specified under subregulation (7) must be later than the end of the period of 21 days beginning on the date on which the notice is given under subregulation (5).

subsection.leadIn: Subregulations (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) do not apply if the Commissioner exercises the power under subregulation (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to amend the validity period specified in the licence after extending it under regulation 12G(7);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to amend the name of the licensee specified in the licence after approving a transfer of the licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to amend the licence to specify any exemption granted under regulation 12H, including any conditions imposed on the exemption.

section.name: s12J
section.heading: Amendment of licence on application by licensee

subsection.leadIn: A fleet licensee may apply to the Commissioner to amend the licensee’s taxi fleet licence in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee specified in the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of taxis in the taxi fleet operated under the licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration mark of any taxi in the taxi fleet.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may grant or refuse an application made under subregulation (1).
An application under subregulation (1) and its grant or refusal under subregulation (2) must be made during the validity period specified in the licence.
The Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision on the application to the applicant.
If the Commissioner refuses the application, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s12K
section.heading: Restriction on transfer of licence
section.content: A fleet licensee must not transfer the licensee’s taxi fleet licence without the approval of the Commissioner.

section.name: s12L
section.heading: Licence to be delivered on amendment etc.

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies if a taxi fleet licence is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amended under regulation 12I or 12J;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cancelled under regulation 12X(1)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: suspended under regulation 12X(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: varied under regulation 12X(1)(c).

subsection.content: The fleet licensee concerned must deliver the licensee’s taxi fleet licence to the Commissioner within 72 hours after the amendment, cancellation, suspension or variation takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: After a taxi fleet licence is delivered under subregulation (2), the Commissioner must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licence is amended—amend the licence and issue the amended licence to the licensee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the licence is cancelled—record the cancellation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the licence is suspended—withhold the licence until the suspension ends; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the licence is varied—vary the licence and issue the varied licence to the licensee.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subregulation (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
If a taxi fleet licence is lost, damaged, defaced or destroyed, the fleet licensee concerned may apply to the Commissioner for a duplicate taxi fleet licence.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a duplicate taxi fleet licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application by the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 1A.

subsection.leadIn: A duplicate taxi fleet licence issued under subregulation (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken to be a licence issued under regulation 12E(1) or 12L(3)(a) or (d) (as the case requires); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the same effect as the original taxi fleet licence.

section.name: s12N
section.heading: Commissioner may issue certificate
section.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a fleet taxi certificate in respect of a fleet taxi operated under a fleet licensee’s taxi fleet licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application by the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 1A.

subsection.leadIn: A fleet taxi certificate is valid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date of issue of the certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: until the earlier of the following—

subparagraph.content: the end of the period of 12 months beginning on the date mentioned in paragraph (a);
the expiry of the relevant licence.

subsection.content: However, if the relevant licence is amended under regulation 12I or 12J or varied under regulation 12X(1)(c) to the effect that the registration mark of the fleet taxi to which the fleet taxi certificate relates is no longer specified in the licence, the certificate ceases to be valid on the date on which the amendment or variation takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: relevant licence (有關牌照), in relation to a fleet taxi certificate, means the taxi fleet licence to which the certificate relates.

section.name: s12P
section.heading: Restriction on transfer of certificate
section.content: A fleet taxi certificate issued in respect of a fleet taxi must not be transferred to another vehicle.

subsection.content: If a fleet taxi certificate is lost, damaged, defaced or destroyed, the fleet licensee concerned may apply to the Commissioner for a duplicate fleet taxi certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a duplicate fleet taxi certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application by the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 1A.

subsection.leadIn: A duplicate fleet taxi certificate issued under subregulation (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken to be a certificate issued under regulation 12N; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the same effect as the original fleet taxi certificate.

section.name: s12R
section.heading: Licensee must maintain proper and efficient service

subsection.content: A fleet licensee must maintain proper and efficient taxi fleet services to the satisfaction of the Commissioner during any period within which the licensee’s taxi fleet licence is valid.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a fleet licensee maintains proper and efficient taxi fleet services, the Commissioner may have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the licensee maintains the services in accordance with—

subparagraph.content: the specified provisions;
the terms and conditions of the licensee’s taxi fleet licence; and
the directions given to the licensee under regulation 12S; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other matters the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may, after consulting a fleet licensee, give a direction to the licensee in respect of a matter that relates to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee’s taxi fleet licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the services provided by the taxi fleet operated under the licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the fleet taxis operated under the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A direction referred to in subregulation (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be given either generally or in a particular case; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be inconsistent with any specified provision or the relevant taxi fleet licence.

subsection.content: If the Commissioner decides to exercise the power under subregulation (1), the Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision and a statement of the reasons for the decision to the licensee.
Subject to subregulation (5) and regulation 12Y(4), the Commissioner’s decision takes effect on the date specified by the Commissioner in the notice.
The date specified under subregulation (4) must be later than the end of the period of 21 days beginning on the date on which the notice is given under subregulation (3).

section.name: s12T
section.heading: Restriction on use of vehicle by licensee

subsection.content: A fleet licensee must not use a vehicle to provide services under the licensee’s taxi fleet licence unless the vehicle is a fleet taxi in respect of the licence.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subregulation (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s12U
section.heading: Display of fleet taxi certificate and fleet taxi plate

subsection.content: A fleet taxi certificate, or a proper printout of a fleet taxi e-certificate, must be displayed on a fleet taxi in the position and in the manner specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: A fleet taxi plate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be of the design, construction, size, colour and form specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be displayed on a fleet taxi in the position and in the manner specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The letters or characters on a fleet taxi plate must be in the size and of the colour specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not drive or use a fleet taxi, or suffer or permit a fleet taxi to be driven or used if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: one or more of the following provisions are not complied with in respect of the taxi—

subparagraph.content: subregulation (1);
subregulation (2);
subregulation (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate, printout or plate displayed on the taxi, purporting to be a fleet taxi certificate, a printout of a fleet taxi e-certificate or a fleet taxi plate—

subparagraph.content: is damaged, altered or defaced;
does not relate to the taxi fleet licence currently in force in respect of the taxi; or
does not relate to the taxi; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a fleet taxi certificate, or a printout of a fleet taxi e-certificate, that is invalid is displayed on the taxi.

subsection.content: A person must not display a fleet taxi certificate, a printout of a fleet taxi e-certificate or a fleet taxi plate on a vehicle unless the vehicle is a fleet taxi.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subregulation (4) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A notice published under subregulation (1), (2) or (3) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: fleet taxi e-certificate (車隊的士電子證明書) means a fleet taxi certificate issued in the form of an electronic record;

proper printout (合規列印本), in relation to a fleet taxi e-certificate, means a clearly legible printout of the e-certificate that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the conditions of the relevant taxi fleet licence.

section.name: s12V
section.heading: Document to be sent for pre-arranged journey

subsection.content: This regulation applies if a fleet taxi is hired for a pre-arranged journey.

subsection.leadIn: The fleet licensee that operates the taxi must send a document (in hard copy form or in the form of an electronic record) containing the following particulars to the hirer before the pre-arranged journey starts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either of the following—

subparagraph.content: if the taxi is hired on an agreed fare arrangement—the agreed fare;
in any other case—the agreed booking fee (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the licensee and the licensee’s taxi fleet licence number;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration mark of the taxi.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subregulation (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Cancellation etc. of Taxi Fleet Licences and Fleet Taxi Certificates

section.name: s12W
section.heading: Commissioner may appoint public officer to conduct inquiry

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may appoint a public officer to conduct an inquiry if the Commissioner has reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fleet licensee fails to maintain proper and efficient taxi fleet services in accordance with regulation 12R; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of a fleet taxi—

subparagraph.content: any condition of the taxi fleet licence to which the taxi relates has not been or is not being complied with; or
any specified provision has not been or is not being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A public officer appointed under subregulation (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fix a time and place for the inquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give written notice of the time and place of the inquiry to the licensee at least 21 days before the inquiry takes place.

subsection.content: A public officer who conducts an inquiry may postpone the inquiry and, if the officer does so, the officer must give written notice to the licensee specifying the date to which the inquiry has been postponed.

subsection.leadIn: At an inquiry, the public officer who conducts it must consider—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any evidence received by the officer, whether tendered on behalf of the licensee or otherwise; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any oral or written representations made by or on behalf of the licensee.

subsection.content: After an inquiry, the public officer who conducts it must report to the Commissioner.

section.name: s12X
section.heading: Commissioner may cancel etc. licence or certificate

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner, after considering a report made under regulation 12W(5), is satisfied as to a matter set out in regulation 12W(1)(a) or (b), the Commissioner may do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the taxi fleet licence concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the licence for a period of time the Commissioner considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: vary the licence in respect of—

subparagraph.content: the number of taxis in the taxi fleet operated under the licence;
the registration mark of any taxi in the taxi fleet;
the validity period of the licence; or
the conditions of the licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: cancel the fleet taxi certificate of the fleet taxi concerned;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: suspend the certificate for a period of time the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Commissioner decides to exercise any power under subregulation (1), the Commissioner must give written notice of the Commissioner’s decision and a statement of the reasons for the decision to the licensee.

Subject to regulation 12Y(4), the Commissioner’s decision takes effect on the date following the end of the period of 21 days beginning on the date on which the notice is given under subregulation (2).

section.name: s12Y
section.heading: Right to apply for review by Transport Tribunal

subsection.content: A person aggrieved by a specified decision may apply in writing to the Commissioner for a review of the decision by a Transport Tribunal.
The application must be made within 21 days beginning on the date on which the written notice of the specified decision is given to the aggrieved person.
Regulations 55A and 55B apply to an application made under subregulation (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a person applies under subregulation (1) for a review of a decision referred to in paragraph (c), (e), (f) or (g) of the definition of specified decision in subregulation (5), the decision does not take effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application for the review is deemed to have been withdrawn under regulation 55A(3)—the date specified by the Commissioner in the notice given under regulation 55A(4) for the taking effect of the decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed or varied by the Transport Tribunal under regulation 55B(2)—the date specified by the Commissioner in the notice given under regulation 55B(3) for the taking effect of the decision (or the decision as varied).

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: specified decision (指明決定) means a decision by the Commissioner—(a)to refuse an application for a taxi fleet licence under regulation 12D(1);(b)to refuse an application for an extension of the validity period of a taxi fleet licence under regulation 12G(4);(c)to amend a taxi fleet licence under regulation 12I(3)(b);(d)to refuse an application to amend a taxi fleet licence under regulation 12J(2);(e)to give a direction under regulation 12S(1);(f)to cancel, suspend or vary a taxi fleet licence under regulation 12X(1)(a), (b) or (c); or(g)to cancel or suspend a fleet taxi certificate under regulation 12X(1)(d) or (e).

section.name: s12Z
section.heading: Paid fee not refundable
section.content: Any fee paid under this Part is not refundable.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: e-permit (電子許可證) means a hire car permit issued in the form of an electronic record; (L.N. 196 of 2022)
hire car permit (出租汽車許可證) means a hire car permit referred to in regulation 14(1);
hire car permit holder (出租汽車許可證持有人) means a person who is the holder of a valid hire car permit;
hire car service (出租汽車服務) means any type of hire car service specified in regulation 14(1);
hotel (酒店) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Hotel Proprietors Ordinance (Cap. 158);
paper permit (紙本許可證) means a hire car permit issued in paper form; (L.N. 196 of 2022)

proper printout (合規格列印本), in relation to an e-permit, means a clearly legible printout of the e-permit that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the conditions of the permit; (L.N. 196 of 2022)
tourist agent (旅遊代理人) means any person carrying on a business in Hong Kong consisting wholly or in part of organizing and conducting tours for, or supplying guides to, visitors to Hong Kong.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Issue or refusal of hire car permits

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this regulation and to regulations 15 and 19, the Commissioner may for the purpose of authorizing the use of a private car for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward, issue in respect of the private car a hire car permit for any of the following types of services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an hotel hire car service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tour hire car service;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an airport hire car service;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a school hire car service;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a private hire car service.

subsection.content: An application for a hire car permit in respect of a private car shall be made to the Commissioner in the specified form by the registered owner of the private car.

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of an application under subregulation (2) and on payment of a fee calculated in accordance with regulation 20, the Commissioner may issue to the applicant a hire car permit if the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is satisfied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as to the particulars furnished in the application;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that there is in force in relation to the user of the private car for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward such policy of insurance or such a security in respect of third party risks as complies with the Motor Vehicles Insurance (Third Party Risks) Ordinance (Cap. 272);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that such policy or security will remain in force during the period of validity of the hire car permit applied for; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that there is in force a vehicle licence in respect of the private car to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the opinion that the type of hire car service specified in the application is reasonably required.

subsection.content: Subject to regulation 18, a hire car permit shall be valid until the vehicle licence of the private car in respect of which the hire car permit is issued next expires; and the Commissioner shall specify the date of expiry of the hire car permit in the permit.

A hire car permit shall be subject to such of the conditions set out in Schedule 3 as are specified in the hire car permit and to such other conditions as the Commissioner may from time to time specify in the hire car permit.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: For a hire car permit issued in respect of a private car that is an e-permit, while a proper printout of the e-permit is displayed on the private car, the printout is deemed to be the original hire car permit. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

The Commissioner may refuse to issue a hire car permit, and if he does so, shall give the applicant notice in writing, either personally or by registered post, of his refusal and inform him of the reasons therefor; and any fee paid by the applicant under subregulation (3) shall be refunded to him.

Where a hire car permit issued under subregulation (1) is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, the Commissioner may, on payment of a fee of $130, issue a duplicate permit, and such permit when issued shall be deemed to be a permit issued under subregulation (1) and shall have the same force and effect as the original permit. (L.N. 185 of 1988; L.N. 266 of 1994; L.N. 200 of 1995; L.N. 524 of 1996; L.N. 196 of 2022)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Restrictions on issue of hire car permits and considerations for issue

subsection.leadIn: A hire car permit for an hotel hire car service may only be issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where an hotel proprietor is the registered owner of the private car, to the hotel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, to the registered owner of the private car who produces, to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, written approval from the proprietor or manager of the hotel concerned for the provision of an hotel hire car service exclusively for that hotel,

subsection.continued: and in determining whether to issue such a hire car permit, the Commissioner may have regard to, amongst other matters, whether the number of bedrooms and general standard of service provided by the hotel to which the application for the hire car permit relates, and its location, are such that an hotel hire car service is reasonably required for such an hotel.

subsection.leadIn: A hire car permit for a tour hire car service may only be issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a tourist agent is the registered owner of the private car, to the tourist agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, to the registered owner of the private car who produces, to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, written approval from a tourist agent for the provision by such owner of a tour hire car service exclusively for that tourist agent,

subsection.continued: and in determining whether to issue such a hire car permit, the Commissioner may have regard to, amongst other matters—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the nature and availability of existing facilities for visitors to tour Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has the means and experience to enable him to provide visitors to Hong Kong with a suitable standard of tour hire car service.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: A hire car permit for an airport hire car service may only be issued to the registered owner of the private car who produces, to the satisfaction of the Commissioner, written approval from the Airport Authority for the provision of an airport hire car service and, in determining whether to issue such a hire car permit, the Commissioner may have regard to, amongst other matters, the nature and availability of existing facilities— (L.N. 326 of 2000)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for persons arriving in Hong Kong by air to reach their destination within Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for persons intending to depart from Hong Kong by air to reach the Hong Kong International Airport.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: No other type of hire car permit shall be issued in addition to a hire car permit for an airport hire car service in respect of the same private car without the further approval in writing of the Airport Authority. (L.N. 326 of 2000; 23 of 2002 s. 92)

subsection.leadIn: A hire car permit for a school hire car service may only be issued to the registered owner of the private car and, in determining whether to issue such a hire car permit, the Commissioner may have regard to, amongst other matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant’s private car is licensed to carry 7 passengers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is able to provide satisfactory evidence that the proposed school hire car service to the school or schools specified in his application is required by the production of written approval from the principal or head of each school concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A hire car permit for a private hire car service may only be issued to the registered owner of the private car and, in determining whether to issue such a hire car permit, the Commissioner may have regard to, amongst other matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the extent to which the area from which the applicant proposes to operate the private hire car service is served by public transport;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is able reasonably to demonstrate that a private hire car service is required in the area from which he proposes to operate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has, in the area from which he proposes to operate the private hire car service, a place which, in the opinion of the Commissioner, is a suitable place to park the private car when it is available for hire.

subsection.content: A hire car permit holder may apply to the Commissioner in the specified form for the renewal of his hire car permit for the same type of hire car service in respect of the same private car at any time during the period of 4 months immediately preceding the date of expiry of his existing hire car permit.

On receipt of an application under subregulation (1) the Commissioner may, subject to regulations 15 and 19, issue to the applicant a new hire car permit for the same type of hire car service in respect of the same private car; and a hire car permit issued under this regulation shall take effect from the date of expiry of the existing hire car permit.

Regulation 14(3), (4), (5), (5A) and (6) and regulation 15 shall apply in relation to an application under subregulation (1) as if it were an application for the issue of a hire car permit under regulation 14(2). (L.N. 196 of 2022)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Replacement of permit for a different vehicle

subsection.content: A hire car permit holder may apply to the Commissioner in the specified form for the cancellation of his hire car permit and for a new hire car permit to be issued to him in replacement thereof for the same type of hire car service in respect of another private car of which the applicant is the registered owner.

On receipt of an application under subregulation (1) the Commissioner may cancel the existing hire car permit and, subject to subregulation (2A) and regulations 15 and 19, issue to the applicant a new hire car permit for the same type of hire car service in respect of the other private car specified in the application.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the existing hire car permit is a paper permit, the Commissioner must not issue a new hire car permit under subregulation (2) unless the existing hire car permit has been surrendered to the Commissioner. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: If the existing hire car permit is an e-permit, after the existing hire car permit is cancelled under subregulation (2), the hire car permit holder must immediately ensure that no printout of the e-permit is displayed on the private car in respect of which the permit is issued. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

Regulation 14(3), (4), (5), (5A) and (6) and regulation 15 shall apply in relation to an application under subregulation (1) as if it were an application for the issue of a hire car permit under regulation 14(2).

section.name: s18
section.heading: Validity of permits
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to regulation 14(4), a hire car permit shall cease to be valid on the happening of any of the following events—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the withdrawal of approval referred to in regulation 15(1)(b), (2)(b) or (3)(a) or (b) for provision of the hire car service concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hire car permit holder ceases to be the registered owner of the private car to which the hire car permit relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the hire car permit holder transfers or otherwise parts with the user of or disposes of the private car to which the hire car permit relates to any other person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the hire car permit is cancelled under regulation 17(2) or 22.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Power to limit number of permits

subsection.content: The Commissioner may by notice in the Gazette limit the number of hire car permits which may at any time be issued for any type of hire car permit specified in regulation 14(1) and may by notice in the Gazette vary any limit so set.
Any limit notified under subregulation (1) shall not affect any hire car permit which is in force when the notice comes into operation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a limit is imposed under subregulation (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner may by notice in the Gazette specify the manner in which, and the date by which, applications under regulation 14(2) may be made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner shall not be obliged to issue permits up to the limit so imposed.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receives applications for hire car permits of a type specified in regulation 14(1) which is the subject of a notice under subregulation (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: would, but for the limit under subregulation (1) on the number of the hire car permits that may be issued for that type, grant applications,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may cause the applications to be determined by lot.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), the fees payable for hire car permits are as follows—

tr.td: for a school hire car service permit (L.N. 524 of 1996)
for any other hire car permit

subsection.leadIn: Where by reason of regulation 14(4) a hire car permit will cease to be valid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 4 months of the date of the proposed issue thereof, the fee payable under this regulation shall be an amount equal to 35 per cent of the relevant annual fee specified in subregulation (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 12 months of, but more than 4 months after, the date of the proposed issue thereof, the fee payable under this regulation shall be an amount equal to the relevant annual fee specified in subregulation (1).

subsection.content: If under regulation 14(4) or for any reason under regulation 18 a hire car permit ceases to be valid, no part of the fee paid under this regulation shall be refunded.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Offences and penalties for breach of permit conditions

subsection.content: Any person who drives or uses any private car in respect of which a hire car permit is issued in contravention of any condition to which the hire car permit is subject under regulation 14(5) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

If an offence under subregulation (1) is committed by any person other than the hire car permit holder, the hire car permit holder also commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

In any proceedings against a hire car permit holder for an offence under subregulation (2) the onus shall be upon the hire car permit holder to satisfy the court or magistrate that he was not aware and had no reasonable grounds for believing that the private car was driven or used in contravention of the condition of the hire car permit.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may cancel a hire car permit if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any condition to which it is subject under regulation 14(5) is contravened; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered owner or a driver of the private car is convicted of an offence under section 52(3), (5), (6), (7) or (8) of the Ordinance or regulation 21.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall cancel a permit if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: there is not in force in relation to the user of the private car for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward such policy of insurance or such a security in respect of third party risks as complies with the Motor Vehicles Insurance (Third Party Risks) Ordinance (Cap. 272); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: registration of the private car is transferred under regulation 16 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E); or (E.R. 3 of 2015)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the vehicle licence of the private car is surrendered to the Commissioner under regulation 24 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E). (E.R. 3 of 2015)

subsection.content: Notification of the cancellation of a permit under subregulation (1) or (2) shall be served forthwith in writing, either personally or by registered post, on the holder of the hire car permit.

subsection.leadIn: Any person aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any condition specified by the Commissioner in a hire car permit under regulation 14(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any decision of the Commissioner under regulation 14(6) or 22(1),

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the issue of the permit; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the notification under regulation 14(6) or 22(3),

subsection.continued: as the case may be, apply to the Commissioner in the appropriate specified form for a review by a Transport Tribunal of the condition or decision.

subsection.content: Regulations 55A and 55B shall apply to an application made under subregulation (1). (L.N. 185 of 1988)

subsection.leadIn: A hire car permit holder must comply with subregulation (1A) if any of the following events happens— (L.N. 196 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notification under regulation 22(3) is received, unless the hire car permit holder applies for a review under regulation 23(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where an application for a review is deemed to have been withdrawn under regulation 55A(3), a notification under regulation 55A(4) is received; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the event of such a review, where the Commissioner’s decision is confirmed under regulation 55B(2), a notification under regulation 55B(3) is received. (L.N. 185 of 1988; L.N. 196 of 2022)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The hire car permit holder must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a paper permit—

subparagraph.content: immediately ensure that the permit is not displayed on the private car in respect of which the permit is issued; and
return the permit to the Commissioner within 30 days after the happening of the event; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an e-permit—immediately ensure that no printout of the e-permit is displayed on the private car in respect of which the permit is issued. (L.N. 196 of 2022)

subsection.content: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subregulation (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (E.R. 6 of 2022)

section.name: s27
section.heading: Production of permit or records on request

subsection.leadIn: A police officer or the Commissioner may require the production for examination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a hire car permit, or a proper printout of a hire car permit that is an e-permit, by any person in charge of a vehicle that the officer or the Commissioner reasonably suspects is being or has been used in the operation of a hire car service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a record referred to in condition 1(b) of Schedule 3 by the operator of a hire car service at the address or addresses specified in the hire car permit.

subsection.leadIn: The operator of a hire car service who, without reasonable excuse, fails to produce—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the hire car permit or proper printout immediately when asked for it under subregulation (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the record mentioned in subregulation (1)(b) immediately when asked for it under that subregulation,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (E.R. 6 of 2022)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may designate an area of road as an area within which a public light bus may stop for the purpose of picking up or setting down passengers.

A public light bus stopping place may be designated under subregulation (1) in respect of more than one public light bus service, and notwithstanding that it is also designated as a bus stop under the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must cause a public light bus stopping place designated under subregulation (1)— (34 of 2023 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the stopping place is not also a bus stop under the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230), to be delineated on the road by means of road markings of the type set out in Figure No. 1 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be indicated by means of a traffic sign—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the stopping place is designated in respect of public light buses on a scheduled service only, of the type set out in Figure No. 2 of Schedule 4; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the stopping place is designated in respect of public light buses on a service other than a scheduled service, of the type set out in Figure No. 3 of Schedule 4.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may designate an area of road as an area within which a public light bus may stand for the purpose of picking up or setting down passengers.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must cause a public light bus stand designated under subregulation (1)— (34 of 2023 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be delineated on the road by means of road markings of the type set out in Figure No. 4 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to be indicated by means of a traffic sign—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the stand is designated in respect of public light buses on a scheduled service only, of the type set out in Figure No. 5 of Schedule 4; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the stand is designated in respect of public light buses on a service other than a scheduled service, of the type set out in Figure No. 6 of Schedule 4.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may designate an area of road as an area within which a taxi may stand or ply for hire.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must cause a taxi stand designated under subregulation (1)— (34 of 2023 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be delineated on the road by means of road markings of the type set out in Figure No. 4 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 7 of Schedule 4.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The Commissioner may designate a taxi stand as a cross-harbour taxi stand. (L.N. 236 of 1995)

subsection.leadIn: Where a taxi stand delineated and indicated in accordance with subregulation (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is designated in respect of taxis that are licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within the New Territories only, the Commissioner must cause the taxi stand to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 10 of Schedule 4;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: is designated in respect of taxis that are licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within Lantau only, the Commissioner must cause the taxi stand to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 10A of Schedule 4; (L.N. 173 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is designated in respect of taxis other than taxis that are licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within the New Territories only; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within Lantau only,

paragraph.continued: the Commissioner must cause the taxi stand to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 11 of Schedule 4; (L.N. 173 of 1997)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is designated in respect of taxis generally, the Commissioner must not cause the taxi stand to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 10, 10A or 11 of Schedule 4; (L.N. 261 of 1984; L.N. 173 of 1997)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is designated as a cross-harbour taxi stand, the Commissioner must cause the taxi stand to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 12 of Schedule 4. (L.N. 236 of 1995; 34 of 2023 s. 18)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may designate an area of road as an area within which a fleet taxi may stop for picking up passengers who hire the taxi for a pre-arranged journey.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must cause a fleet taxi stopping place designated under subregulation (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be delineated on the road by means of a road marking of the type set out in Figure No. 1 of Schedule 4A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be indicated by means of a traffic sign of the type set out in Figure No. 2 of Schedule 4A.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Designation of temporary stands and stopping places
section.leadIn: The Commissioner of Police may designate an area of road as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public light bus stopping place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public light bus stand;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a taxi stand; or (34 of 2023 s. 20)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an area within which a fleet taxi may stop for picking up passengers who hire the taxi for a pre-arranged journey, (34 of 2023 s. 20)

section.continued: for any period not exceeding 72 hours and may indicate such designation by traffic signs of such type and description as the Commissioner of Police considers appropriate.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Temporary suspension of stands and stopping places
section.leadIn: The Commissioner of Police may suspend—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public light bus stopping place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public light bus stand;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a taxi stand; or (34 of 2023 s. 21)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a fleet taxi stopping place, (34 of 2023 s. 21)

section.continued: for any period not exceeding 72 hours by—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: covering or removing any traffic signs; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the placing of signs of such type and description as the Commissioner of Police considers appropriate. (34 of 2023 s. 21)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Picking up and setting down passengers

subsection.content: The driver of a public light bus on a scheduled service shall not stop to pick up or set down passengers except as specified in the passenger service licence in respect of such service.

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a public light bus on a service other than a scheduled service, shall not stop to pick up or set down passengers except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at a public light bus stand or public light bus stopping place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when requested by a passenger or hailed by an intending passenger.

subsection.content: The driver of a public bus on any public bus service shall not stop to pick up or set down passengers except as specified in the passenger service licence in respect of such service.

The driver of a public bus or public light bus on hire within the meaning of regulation 38 shall not stop to pick up or set down passengers except at a place specified in a pre-arranged contract of hire.

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a taxi shall not stop to pick up or set down passengers except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at a taxi stand designated in respect of the taxi under regulation 30; or (L.N. 261 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when requested by a passenger or hailed by an intending passenger.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Despite subregulation (5), the driver of a fleet taxi may stop at a fleet taxi stopping place to pick up passengers who hire the taxi for a pre-arranged journey. (34 of 2023 s. 22)

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this regulation shall be construed as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permitting the driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi to stop for the purpose of picking up or setting down passengers at any place or in any manner prohibited by these regulations, the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G) or any other enactment; or (E.R. 3 of 2015)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: preventing the driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi from stopping for the purpose of enabling any person to remove himself from the vehicle when ordered to do so under regulation 56.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Use of stands and stopping places by public service vehicles

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by the use of the time plate in Figure No. 8 or 9 of Schedule 4, placed in conjunction with the traffic sign in Figure No. 5, 6 or 7 of that Schedule, as appropriate, specify when a public light bus stand or taxi stand may be used as such and when it may be used for parking by any class of vehicle specified on the sign.

content.leadIn: Subject to subregulations (3) and (4), the driver of a public light bus or taxi shall not park his vehicle at a public light bus stand or taxi stand, as the case may be, except where a traffic sign and time plate referred to in subregulation (1) so permit: (L.N. 261 of 1984)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that a vehicle shall be deemed not to be parked for the purposes of this subregulation where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a taxi, it is standing for hire at a taxi stand; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a public light bus, it is standing for the purpose of picking up or setting down passengers at a public light bus stand.

subsection.content: The driver of a public light bus on a service other than a scheduled service shall not stop or park his vehicle at any public light bus stopping place or public light bus stand which, under regulation 28 or 29, is designated in respect of public light buses on a scheduled service only.
The driver of a taxi shall not stop or park his taxi at any taxi stand other than at a taxi stand designated in respect of the taxi under regulation 30. (L.N. 261 of 1984)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Conduct at public light bus stands

subsection.leadIn: The driver of each of the first 2 public light buses standing at a public light bus stand—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not, without reasonable excuse, leave his vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be ready and willing at all times to drive his vehicle from the stand.

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a public light bus standing at a public light bus stand shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: move up his vehicle as vacancies occur;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he is requested to do so by the driver of another public light bus, move his vehicle in order to permit the other public light bus to be driven from the stand; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: move his vehicle, in accordance with any direction given to him by a police officer or traffic warden in uniform, from the stand or to any position within the stand.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall without lawful authority obstruct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a driver of a public light bus from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: moving his vehicle into a public light bus stand, which has a vacant space therein;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: moving his vehicle forward in turn to any space in front of his vehicle that becomes vacant within the public light bus stand;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: picking up passengers when his vehicle is stopped or standing within a public light bus stand; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: moving his vehicle away from a public light bus stand; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person from boarding a public light bus that is stopped or standing within a public light bus stand.

subsection.content: Nothing in this regulation shall be construed as preventing the driver of a public light bus from parking his vehicle at a public light bus stand where a traffic sign and time plate referred to in regulation 34(1) so permit.
The driver of each of the first 2 taxis at a taxi stand shall sit in or stand beside his taxi and shall be ready to be hired at once by any person.
The driver of every taxi at a taxi stand shall move up his taxi as vacancies occur.

subsection.leadIn: If a person wishes to engage a taxi—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver of the first taxi at the taxi stand shall accept the hire; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the driver of a taxi other than the first taxi at the stand shall not accept the hire, unless the drivers of all taxis ahead of his taxi at the stand have either accepted a hire or are not in or near their taxis.

subsection.content: Nothing in this regulation shall be construed as preventing the driver of a taxi from parking his vehicle at a taxi stand where a traffic sign and time plate referred to in regulation 34(1) so permit.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Obligations of Drivers, Passenger Service Licensees and Passengers

section.name: s37
section.heading: Obligations of taxi driver
section.leadIn: The driver of a taxi must not without reasonable excuse— (34 of 2023 s. 23)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully refuse or neglect to accept a hire from a hirer whether the intention of such hirer is indicated expressly or by implication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse or neglect to drive the taxi to any place indicated by a hirer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse or neglect to carry such number of passengers, not exceeding the number specified in the vehicle licence in respect of the taxi, as the driver may be required to carry by the hirer; (34 of 2023 s. 23)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: when hired to drive to a specified destination, drive to such destination other than by the most direct practicable route;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: when the driver’s taxi is hired, permit any person other than the hirer to enter the taxi without the consent of the hirer; (L.N. 149 of 1997; 34 of 2023 s. 23)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: refuse or neglect, after payment has been made by any person of any fare for the hiring of a taxi, to issue on demand by that person made at any time before the taxi is hired by any other person a receipt complying with the requirements of regulation 49A in respect of such payment, unless the taxi is— (L.N. 149 of 1997; 34 of 2023 s. 23)

subparagraph.content: a general taxi hired under regulation 38; or
a fleet taxi hired on an agreed fare arrangement. (34 of 2023 s. 23)

section.name: s37A
section.heading: Driver may refuse hire or to drive if passenger fails to wear seat belt
section.content: The driver of a taxi or public light bus when acting as such may refuse a hire or to drive the vehicle if a passenger in the vehicle who is required by regulation 7A or 7B of the Road Traffic (Safety Equipment) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. F) to wear a seat belt refuses or fails to do so.

section.name: s37B
section.heading: Cases where taxi driver plying for hire at a cross-harbour taxi stand may refuse hire
section.content: Notwithstanding regulation 37, the driver of a taxi which is standing or plying for hire at a cross-harbour taxi stand may refuse to accept any hire which is not for a destination across the harbour via the Cross-Harbour Tunnel, the Western Harbour Crossing or the Eastern Harbour Crossing.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Hiring of public service vehicle as a whole

subsection.content: The registered owner of a public bus or public light bus, if permitted to do so under the terms of a passenger service licence which is in force in respect of the vehicle, and the registered owner of a general taxi, may hire the vehicle to any person at a rate of hire based on the time during which the vehicle is hired with or without additional charge in respect of the mileage travelled by the vehicle while it is so hired, or on such other terms as may be agreed with the hirer. (34 of 2023 s. 24)

A condition of the hiring of a vehicle under subregulation (1) may be that it shall be driven only by a person in the employ of the registered owner of the vehicle or that such a person is provided to drive the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Before a vehicle is hired under subregulation (1), the registered owner and hirer shall complete and sign 2 copies of a document which shall contain the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rate or scale of charges applicable to the hiring;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: details of the third party risks insurance held in respect of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names and addresses of the persons who are permitted to drive the vehicle while it is the subject of the hiring and the numbers of their driving licences.

subsection.content: The registered owner shall retain one copy of the document and shall produce it on demand by a police officer made within 3 months after the commencement of the hiring.
The hirer shall retain one copy of the document and shall produce it on demand by a police officer made during the continuance of the hiring.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Insurance and driving licence
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in regulation 38, the registered owner of a public bus, public light bus or general taxi must not hire the vehicle to any person unless the registered owner is satisfied, in respect of each person whose name appears on the document referred to in regulation 38(3) as a person permitted to drive the vehicle, that— (34 of 2023 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the continuance of the hiring there is in force in relation to the user of the vehicle by each such person, such policy of insurance or such a security in respect of third party risks as complies with the Motor Vehicles Insurance (Third Party Risks) Ordinance (Cap. 272); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each such person is the holder of a valid driving licence issued under the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. B) which entitles that person to drive the public bus, public light bus or general taxi, as the case may be. (E.R. 3 of 2015; 34 of 2023 s. 25)

section.name: s40
section.heading: Soliciting
section.content: No driver or person acting or purporting to act on behalf of the driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi, shall in any manner attract or endeavour to attract any person in order to induce such person to make use of the vehicle.

subsection.content: No goods other than personal hand baggage shall be carried on a public bus, public light bus or taxi, except, in the case of a public bus or public light bus, goods carried for hire or reward in accordance with a goods permit issued under the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E). (E.R. 3 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: No personal hand baggage which is permitted under subregulation (1) shall include any goods which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are of a dangerous or offensive nature; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not securely wrapped.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subregulation (1), in this regulation—
subsection.def: personal hand baggage (個人手提行李) includes wheelchairs, crutches or any other thing used as an aid to or means of mobility, carried by any passenger. (L.N. 353 of 1988)

subsection.content: The carriage of animals and birds on a public bus or public light bus or in a taxi and the terms and conditions under which any animal or bird is carried shall be at the sole discretion of the passenger service licensee in respect of the vehicle or, in the case of a taxi, the driver of the vehicle. (34 of 2023 s. 2)
Any person who is permitted to take any animal or bird on a vehicle under subregulation (1) shall be responsible for and shall pay for any damage caused to the vehicle by the animal or bird.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Cleanliness
