section.content: The passenger service licensee in respect of a public bus or public light bus and the driver of a taxi shall ensure that the vehicle is kept in a clean and tidy condition.

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi, when acting as such—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must behave in a civil and orderly manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must keep himself or herself clean and tidy and be adequately clothed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must not smoke in or on the vehicle when it has passengers on board;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must take all reasonable precautions to ensure the safety of passengers in or on or entering or alighting from the vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.leadIn: must, on request by any police officer or traffic warden in uniform or any person authorized by the Commissioner of Police, provide—

subparagraph.content: the driver’s name and address; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the name and address of the following person who employs the driver—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the passenger service licensee;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the fleet licensee; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the owner; (34 of 2023 s. 26)

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: must not cause the vehicle to remain stationary on a road longer than is necessary to pick up or set down passengers except at a stand or place where such vehicles are permitted to stop for a longer time than is necessary for that purpose;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: must not unreasonably delay the journey; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: must not congregate or assemble with other drivers to the annoyance of members of the public. (34 of 2023 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: A driver, when in charge of a taxi, must— (34 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not deceive or refuse to inform a passenger or intending passenger as to the proper fare and route to any place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at all times when the taxi is available for hire or is hired, carry, for the purpose of giving change, not less than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: $90 in notes of a denomination of $10 or in coins of a denomination of $2 or more; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: $10 in coins of a denomination of $1 or less; and (34 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: c

subparagraph.content: at a taxi stand; or
when being hailed by an intending passenger for pickup,

paragraph.continued: unless an accident, or another unavoidable cause, compels the driver to stop otherwise than in the circumstances described in subparagraphs (i) and (ii). (34 of 2023 s. 52)

section.name: s45A
section.heading: Conduct of passengers in relation to seat belts

subsection.leadIn: A passenger in a taxi or public light bus who is required by regulation 7A or 7B of the Road Traffic (Safety Equipment) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. F) to wear a seat belt but who refuses or fails to do so must— (E.R. 3 of 2015; 34 of 2023 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: leave the vehicle if so required by the driver, an authorized person or a police officer; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a taxi, subject to subregulation (2), pay the fare then recorded on the taximeter (recorded fare); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a public light bus, pay, if the passenger has not already done so, the fare indicated at the time the passenger boarded the vehicle on the card displayed in accordance with regulation 50(3). (34 of 2023 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subregulation (1)(b)(i)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the taxi is a general taxi hired under regulation 38—the passenger must pay the fare calculated in accordance with regulation 38(1) instead of the recorded fare; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the taxi is a fleet taxi hired for a pre-arranged journey—

subparagraph.content: where the taxi is hired on an agreed fare arrangement—the passenger must pay the agreed fare instead of the recorded fare; or
in any other case—the passenger must pay the agreed booking fee (if any) in addition to the recorded fare. (34 of 2023 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: A passenger or intending passenger on a public bus, public light bus or taxi shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use obscene or offensive language or conduct himself in a disorderly manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully obstruct, impede or distract the driver of the vehicle or an authorized person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: wilfully do or cause to be done with respect to any part of the vehicle or its equipment, or any accessory thereto, anything which is calculated—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to obstruct or interfere with the working of the vehicle or to cause damage; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to cause injury, discomfort, annoyance or inconvenience to any other person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: spit or wilfully damage, soil, deface or defile any part of the vehicle or any equipment thereon, or any accessory thereto;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: wilfully remove, displace, deface or alter any number plate, fare table, route indicator or destination board or any printed or other notice or advertisement in or on the vehicle;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: drive the vehicle, or interfere with its doors or any other mechanism, device or control which forms part of the vehicle or which is connected with the vehicle;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: enter or alight from the vehicle while it is in motion;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: when entering or attempting to enter the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: impede any passenger seeking to enter or alight from the vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: behave in any other manner which is likely to delay the vehicle;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: enter, remain or travel in or on the vehicle while in possession of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any firearm, unless he is a police officer, or member of the Hong Kong Auxiliary Police Force under the Hong Kong Auxiliary Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 233) or of the Customs and Excise Service under the Customs and Excise Service Ordinance (Cap. 342), and is on duty; or (L.N. 362 of 1997; 76 of 1999 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other dangerous or offensive article;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: enter or remain in or on the vehicle when requested not to do so by the driver or an authorized person on the grounds that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the petrol or oil tank of the vehicle is to be filled;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the vehicle is carrying its full complement of passengers; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the driver or passenger service licensee is debarred, by reason of any enactment or by reason of any condition attached to the vehicle licence or passenger service licence issued in respect of the vehicle, from permitting any passenger to enter or remain in the vehicle at the place in question; (34 of 2023 s. 2)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: enter or alight from the vehicle when requested not to do so by the driver or an authorized person on the grounds that, by reason of any enactment or by reason of any condition attached to the vehicle licence or passenger service licence issued in respect of the vehicle, the place in question is a place where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the vehicle is not permitted to stop; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the passengers are prohibited from entering or alighting from the vehicle;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: if his condition is such as to be offensive to passengers on the vehicle, or the condition of his dress or clothing is such that it may be reasonably expected to soil or injure any lining, cushion, seat or other part of the vehicle or the clothing of any passenger on the vehicle, enter or remain in or on the vehicle after the driver of the vehicle, or an authorized person or police officer, has requested him—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not to enter the vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to leave the vehicle,

paragraph.continued: by reason of his condition or of the condition of his dress or clothing;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: bring any article into or onto the vehicle without the permission of the driver or an authorized person, or place such article in any place in which such driver or authorized person may have requested him not to place such article;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: when in or on the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: use or operate to the annoyance of any other person any noisy or musical instrument or any gramophone, radio or tape player;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: make or combine with any other person to make excessive noise by singing or shouting;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: throw within the vehicle or on to any road or footway any article or thing;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: attach to or trail from the vehicle any streamer, balloon, flag or other article or set or put any thing out of the vehicle in such manner as to overhang the road; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: lean out or put any limb out of the vehicle in such manner as to overhang the road.

subsection.leadIn: A passenger or intending passenger on a public bus or public light bus shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the vehicle otherwise than by the door or opening provided for the entry of passengers, or alight from a vehicle other than from the door or opening provided for the exit of passengers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: while in or on the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beg;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sell or offer for sale any article except with the permission of the driver or passenger service licensee; or (34 of 2023 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: distribute printed, written or similar matter of any description or distribute any article for the purpose of advertising.

subsection.content: The scale of fares for the hiring of taxis shall be as specified in Schedule 5.
A person who is in charge of a taxi must not charge for the hire of the taxi a fare exceeding the relevant fare. (34 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subregulation (2), each of the following persons is in charge of the taxi—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the taxi is a general taxi—the registered owner and driver of the taxi;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the taxi is a fleet taxi—the fleet licensee that operates the taxi and the driver of the taxi. (34 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.content: Light personal hand baggage, that is to say, light suitcases, hat boxes, attache cases and similar articles may be carried inside the passenger compartment of the taxi and if so shall be carried free of charge.
Wheelchairs and crutches of a disabled person who is a passenger in a taxi shall not be regarded as baggage for the purposes of additional fares specified in Schedule 5. (L.N. 353 of 1988)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: relevant fare (有關車費) means—(a)in relation to a general taxi—(i)if the taxi is hired under regulation 38—the fare calculated in accordance with regulation 38(1); or(ii)if the taxi is hired other than under regulation 38—the fare calculated in accordance with the scale of fares specified in Schedule 5; or(b)in relation to a fleet taxi—(i)if the taxi is hired for a pre-arranged journey—(A)where the taxi is hired on an agreed fare arrangement—the agreed fare; or(B)in any other case—the fare calculated in accordance with the scale of fares specified in Schedule 5, plus the agreed booking fee (if any); or(ii)if the taxi is hired other than for a pre-arranged journey—the fare calculated in accordance with the scale of fares specified in Schedule 5. (34 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hire a taxi, knowing or having reason to believe that he cannot pay the legal fare chargeable under regulation 47 and with intent to avoid payment of the legal fare;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dishonestly endeavour to avoid payment of a legal fare lawfully due from him; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having failed or refused to pay the fare demanded by the driver of a taxi, either refuse to give to the driver of the taxi his name and an address at which he can be found or give, with intent to deceive, a false name or address.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: board a public bus or a public light bus, knowing or having reason to believe that he cannot pay the fare and with intent to avoid payment of the fare; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dishonestly avoid payment of a fare due from him.

subsection.def: In subregulation (2) fare (車費), in relation to a public light bus, means the fare indicated on the card displayed on the vehicle under regulation 50(3).

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a taxi available for hire must— (34 of 2023 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: display the taximeter indicator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the hours of darkness keep the “TAXI” sign illuminated. (34 of 2023 s. 29)

subsection.content: The driver of a taxi as soon as the taxi has been hired shall move the taximeter indicator to the recording position and as soon as the hiring has terminated shall return the taximeter indicator to the non-recording position.

For the purposes of subregulation (2) the hiring of the taxi shall commence from the time at which the journey begins or the time at which the taxi is first made immediately available to the hirer at the time and place appointed by the hirer, whichever first occurs.

subsection.leadIn: If for the distance covered the taximeter records a fare clearly higher than the fare calculated in accordance with the scale of fares specified in Schedule 5 (Schedule 5 fare), the hirer of the taxi is not obliged to pay to the driver more than— (34 of 2023 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the taxi is a fleet taxi hired for a pre-arranged journey—the Schedule 5 fare, plus the agreed booking fee (if any); or (34 of 2023 s. 29)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the Schedule 5 fare. (34 of 2023 s. 29)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: Subregulations (2), (3) and (4) do not apply in relation to a general taxi hired under regulation 38 and a fleet taxi hired on an agreed fare arrangement. (34 of 2023 s. 29)

subsection.def: In this regulation taximeter indicator (的士計程錶指示器) means the taximeter indicator referred to in regulation 42(1) of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A). (L.N. 261 of 1984)

section.name: s49A
section.heading: Receipts in respect of fares paid for hiring of a taxi

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), a receipt issued for the purposes of these regulations in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of a taxi shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be printed by the receipt printing device installed in respect of the taxi; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements set out in Part I of Schedule 9.

subsection.leadIn: Where the receipt printing device installed in respect of a taxi is not in proper working order, a receipt issued for the purposes of these regulations in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of the taxi shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be issued by the driver of the taxi to whom the payment has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements set out in Part II of Schedule 9.

subsection.content: Subregulations (1) and (2) do not apply in relation to a general taxi hired under regulation 38 and a fleet taxi hired on an agreed fare arrangement. (34 of 2023 s. 30)

section.name: s49E
section.heading: Designation of information system by Commissioner

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an information system for the purposes of this Part and Part IIIA of Cap. 374A.
A notice published under subregulation (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s50
section.heading: Destination indicators and fares to be displayed on public light buses

subsection.content: A driver of a public light bus when acting as such shall ensure that, at all times when it is used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward, there is displayed at the front of the vehicle a destination indicator that indicates the destination of the vehicle in a clearly visible and legible manner. (L.N. 40 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: A destination indicator displayed on a public light bus must— (L.N. 40 of 2020)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of a design and construction specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette; (L.N. 374 of 1989)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: comply with the colour requirements specified in Schedule 6. (L.N. 40 of 2020)

subsection.content: A driver of a public light bus when acting as such shall ensure that, at all times when it is used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward, there is displayed at the front of the vehicle in a prominent position a card which complies with subregulation (4) showing the fare chargeable for carriage to the destination indicated on the destination indicator.

subsection.leadIn: A card displayed on a vehicle in accordance with subregulation (3) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of a design and construction specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette; (L.N. 374 of 1989)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: indicate the fare in Arabic numerals with the dollar sign (“$”). (L.N. 40 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: A passenger service licensee in respect of a public light bus, and a driver of a public light bus when acting as such, shall not— (34 of 2023 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: change or remove a destination indicator while passengers are being carried thereon with intent to induce any passenger to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: alight from the vehicle before reaching the destination indicated on the indicator at the time the passenger boarded the vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, require any passenger to alight from the vehicle before reaching the destination indicated on the destination indicator at the time the passenger boarded the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cause or permit to be displayed at the front of the vehicle more than one destination indicator at any one time.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Information to be displayed on certain public service vehicles

subsection.leadIn: When a taxi is standing or plying for hire the driver shall, subject to subregulation (1A), display so as to be clearly visible to any passenger travelling in the taxi and legible to the passenger— (L.N. 374 of 1989; 25 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a table showing in English and in Chinese characters the scale of fares chargeable in respect of the use of the taxi;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration mark of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a taxi driver identity plate in a holder. (L.N. 62 of 1994)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A table referred to in subregulation (1) shall be of a design and construction and displayed in such position in the taxi as specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette. (L.N. 374 of 1989; L.N. 62 of 1994)
The passenger service licensee in respect of a public light bus shall ensure that there is displayed on a plate inside the vehicle the registration mark of the vehicle. (34 of 2023 s. 2)

The owner of a taxi or a public light bus shall ensure that there is displayed on the taxi or the public light bus, so as to be clearly visible at all times of the day and night to any passenger who is required by regulation 7A or 7B of the Road Traffic (Safety Equipment) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. F) to wear a seat belt, a notice which shall meet the requirements of Schedule 8. (L.N. 38 of 1989; L.N. 162 of 2000; E.R. 2 of 2012)

No person shall drive a taxi or a public light bus when it is being used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward unless there is displayed on the taxi or the public light bus a notice required to be displayed in accordance with subregulation (3). (L.N. 38 of 1989)

No person shall drive a taxi when it is being used for the carriage of passengers for hire or reward unless there is displayed in the taxi, so as to be clearly visible to any passenger travelling in the taxi and legible to the passenger, a taxi driver identity plate in a holder, both of which comply with the requirements of subregulations (6) and (7). (L.N. 62 of 1994; 25 of 2018 s. 4)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: When a public light bus is standing for the purpose of picking up passengers, or being used for the carriage of passengers, for hire or reward, the driver must display in it a public light bus driver identity plate that complies with subregulation (6) in a holder that complies with subregulation (7) and neither of which is in any way obscured. (6 of 2012 s. 18)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: A driver identity plate referred to in this regulation is valid for 10 years from the date of issue. (25 of 2018 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The driver identity plate referred to in subregulations (1)(c), (5) and (5A) must— (6 of 2012 s. 18)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: be a valid driver identity plate; (25 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of the size, design, form and construction, and displayed in the position in the taxi or public light bus, as specified by the Commissioner by notice in the Gazette; (6 of 2012 s. 18; 25 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: show—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a taxi driver identity plate, the captions “TAXI DRIVER IDENTITY PLATE” and “的士司機證”; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a public light bus driver identity plate, the captions “PUBLIC LIGHT BUS DRIVER IDENTITY PLATE” and “公共小巴司機證”; (6 of 2012 s. 18)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: show the driver’s full name as shown in his identity card in English and, where appropriate, in Chinese;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: bear the driver’s photograph that is recent as at the date of issue; (25 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: show the date of issue and the date of expiry; and (25 of 2018 s. 4)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: not show or bear any thing or matter that is not specified in paragraphs (b), (c), (d) and (da) or that is not in accordance with the form specified under paragraph (a). (L.N. 62 of 1994; 25 of 2018 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The holder referred to in subregulations (1)(c), (5) and (5A) must— (6 of 2012 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of the size, design and construction, and displayed in the position in the taxi or public light bus, as specified by the Commissioner by notice in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: show the registration mark of the taxi or public light bus. (L.N. 62 of 1994; 6 of 2012 s. 18)

subsection.content: A notice under subregulation (6) or (7) is not subsidiary legislation. (6 of 2012 s. 18)

section.name: s52
section.heading: Information on services operated under a passenger service licence

subsection.content: Subject to subregulation (2), a passenger service licensee may display signs indicating the services provided by the licensee. (34 of 2023 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A sign referred to in subregulation (1) shall not be displayed unless it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a type; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at a place,

subsection.continued: specified by the Commissioner by notice published in the Gazette. (L.N. 374 of 1989)

section.name: s53
section.heading: Lost property found by passengers
section.content: Any person who finds any property accidentally left in a public bus, public light bus or taxi shall immediately hand it in the state in which he finds it to the driver or an authorized person, who shall deal with it in accordance with these regulations.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Search for lost property
section.content: Immediately after the termination of every journey or hiring of a public bus, public light bus or taxi, the driver or an authorized person shall carefully search the vehicle to ascertain whether any property has been accidentally left therein and if the vehicle is not searched by the driver or an authorized person at the termination of the journey or hiring it shall be done as soon as is practicable thereafter.

content.leadIn: Any driver or authorized person who finds any property left in a public bus, public light bus or taxi or any person to whom any such property is handed shall, within 6 hours, deposit such property at a police station in the state in which it was found by or handed to him and shall truly state the particulars of such finding:
content.proviso: Provided that if such property is sooner claimed by the owner thereof and satisfactory proof of ownership is given, it shall be restored to the owner forthwith instead of being deposited at a police station.

subsection.content: Any property deposited in a police station in accordance with the provisions of subregulation (1) shall be disposed of in accordance with sections 40, 41 and 43 of the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

On receipt of an application for a review of the Commissioner’s decision by a Transport Tribunal, the Commissioner shall fix a time and place for the review and give not less than 14 days’ notice in writing thereof, either personally or by registered post, to the applicant, and shall inform him that if neither he nor his authorized representative appears at the hearing and no written representations are received, the application shall be treated as withdrawn.

A Transport Tribunal may postpone a review if it thinks fit and where a review is postponed the Commissioner shall cause a notice in writing to be served, either personally or by registered post, on the applicant specifying the date to which the review has been postponed, and shall inform him that if neither he nor his authorized representative appears at the hearing and no written representations are received, the application shall be treated as withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant or his authorized representative does not appear before the Transport Tribunal on the date of the review notified to him in a notice under subregulation (1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application makes no written representations,

subsection.continued: his application for a review shall be deemed to have been withdrawn.

subsection.content: Where an applicant for a review is deemed to have been withdrawn under subregulation (3), the Commissioner shall give notice thereof in writing, either personally or by registered post, to the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: On a review a Transport Tribunal shall consider—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any evidence received by it, whether tendered on behalf of the applicant or otherwise, which it considers relevant to the review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any representations made by or on behalf of the applicant, whether orally or in writing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any representations made by or on behalf of the Commissioner, whether orally or in writing.

subsection.content: The Transport Tribunal may confirm, vary or reverse the condition or decision specified or made by the Commissioner.
The Commissioner shall give notice in writing, either personally or by registered post, to an applicant of the Transport Tribunal’s decision under subregulation (2).
The decision of the Transport Tribunal under subregulation (2) shall be final.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Powers of drivers of certain public service vehicles to refuse entry and demand removal

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any other provision of these regulations, the driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi may refuse entry to his vehicle or may order any person to remove himself from the vehicle where he has reasonable grounds to believe that such person has committed or is about to commit an offence against these regulations.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been refused entry under subregulation (1), enter the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having been ordered to remove himself from the vehicle under subregulation (1), fail to comply with such order.

subsection.content: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes any of the provisions of, or any requirement under, regulation 12(4), 34, 35, 36, 38, 39, 45(1), 45A, 46, 48 or 49(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 38 of 1989; L.N. 207 of 1989)

Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes any of the provisions of, or any requirement under, regulation 11(1), 17(2B), 33, 41, 44, 50, 51(1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (5A), 52(2), 53, 54, 55(1) or 56(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1. (L.N. 38 of 1989; L.N. 62 of 1994; 6 of 2012 s. 19; L.N. 196 of 2022; 34 of 2023 s. 53)

Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes any of the provisions of, or any requirement under, regulation 37(c), (e) or (f), 45(2) or 49(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 207 of 1989; L.N. 652 of 1994; L.N. 149 of 1997)

A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 37(d) or 40 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 652 of 1994; 34 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 37(a) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a first conviction—to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (34 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 37(b) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a first conviction—to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (34 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 47(2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a first conviction—to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction—to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (34 of 2023 s. 53)

section.name: s58
section.heading: Powers of arrest

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver of a public bus, public light bus or taxi who is on duty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized person who is on duty,

section.continued: believes on reasonable grounds that a person (that person) has committed an offence against regulation 45A, 46, 48 or 56, the driver or authorized person may apprehend that person, and detain that person until that person is handed over to a police officer.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Forms
section.content: The Commissioner may specify any form required for the purposes of these regulations.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Revocation
section.content: The Road Traffic (Public Omnibus, Public Light Bus and Public Car) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) and the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) are revoked.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the provisions of any other enactment, Schedule 7 shall have effect for the purposes of transition to the provisions of these regulations from the provisions of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Road Traffic (Public Omnibus, Public Light Bus and Public Car) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) and the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) revoked by regulation 60 of these regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) revoked by regulation 61 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E),

subsection.continued: and shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may by order amend Schedule 7. (3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: The driver of a taxi which is, immediately before the commencement‡ of the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) (Amendment) (No. 5) Regulation 1997 (L.N. 149 of 1997), registered shall be exempt from complying with regulations 37(f) and 49A at any time before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the installation of a receipt printing device in respect of the taxi; or

section.name: s62
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to conversion of taximeters

subsection.leadIn: Where the scale of fares for the hiring of taxis specified in Schedule 5 is amended, until the taximeter of a taxi affected by the amendment has been— (L.N. 350 of 1990)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: converted to record the scale of fares as amended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: tested, stamped and sealed by the Commissioner,

subsection.continued: there shall be displayed in a prominent position inside such taxi a notice in a form specified by the Commissioner setting out a table for converting the reading on such taximeter to the appropriate fare as amended. (L.N. 140 of 1990)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Where the scale of fares for the hiring of taxis specified in Schedule 5 is amended, until the taximeter of a taxi affected by the amendment has been converted to record the scale of fares as amended, a receipt issued for the purposes of these regulations in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of the taxi shall, apart from complying with the requirements of regulation 49A, set out in manuscript, next to the total amount of the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter, the total amount of the fare chargeable in accordance with the scale of fares as amended. (L.N. 149 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: If, in respect of a taxi—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice referred to in subregulation (1) is not displayed in accordance with that subregulation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a receipt issued for the purposes of these regulations in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of the taxi does not in accordance with subregulation (1A) set out the total amount of the fare chargeable in accordance with the scale of fares as amended within the meaning of that subregulation,

subsection.continued: the fare for the hiring of the taxi shall be the fare specified in subregulation (3). (L.N. 149 of 1997; L.N. 219 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: The fare specified for the purposes of subregulation (2) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the fare recorded on the taximeter does not exceed the appropriate amount chargeable under Schedule 5, the fare recorded on the taximeter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the fare recorded on the taximeter exceeds the appropriate amount chargeable under Schedule 5, that amount. (L.N. 219 of 2008)

section.name: s63
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to driver identity plates

subsection.content: The pre-amended Regulations continue to apply to a driver identity plate issued before the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Road Traffic (Amendment) Ordinance 2018 (25 of 2018);
driver identity plate (司機證) means a taxi driver identity plate or a public light bus driver identity plate referred to in regulation 51;
pre-amended Regulations (《未經修訂規例》) means these regulations as in force immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: The hire car service shall be operated only from an address—

section.name: s2
section.content: The hire car permit shall be displayed inside the private car in respect of which it is issued in such manner as is approved by the Commissioner in writing.

section.name: s3
section.content: A hire car permit holder shall not place or cause to be placed on or in the private car any marking, words, sign or device visible on or from the outside of the car except such as may be approved or required by law or by the Commissioner in writing.

section.name: s4
section.content: The private car shall not be fitted with any equipment permitting the driver to transmit and receive messages by radio, unless the hire car permit is for an hotel hire car service or an airport hire car service.

section.name: s5
section.content: A private car in respect of which a hire car permit is issued for an hotel hire car service shall not be hired other than for the conveyance of guests of an hotel which is specified in the hire car permit and of persons bona fide accompanying such guests.

section.name: s6
section.content: A private car in respect of which a hire car permit is issued for a tour hire car service shall not be hired other than for the conveyance of visitors to Hong Kong and of persons bona fide accompanying such visitors on a journey which commences and terminates at the same point.

section.name: s7
section.content: A private car in respect of which a hire car permit is issued for an airport hire car service shall not be hired other than for the conveyance of persons who board or alight from the vehicle at the Hong Kong International Airport. (23 of 2002 s. 93)

section.name: s8
section.content: A private car in respect of which a hire car permit is issued for a school hire car service shall not be hired other than for the conveyance of the students, teachers and employees of any schools.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Colour Requirements for Indicating Destination of Public Light Buses

section.name: s1
section.content: For a destination indicated by means of a roller blind—letters and characters in white on a dark blue, green, yellow or red background.

section.name: s2
section.content: For a destination indicated by any other means—letters and characters in yellow or amber on a dark non-reflective background.

section.name: s1
section.content: An area of road designated as a taxi stand under regulation 13(1) of the revoked Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) shall be deemed to have been designated as a taxi stand under regulation 30(1) of these regulations.

section.name: s2
section.content: An area of road designated as a public light bus stand under regulation 39A(1) of the revoked Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) shall be deemed to have been designated as a public light bus stand under regulation 29(1) of these regulations.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any road marking delineated or sign erected in accordance with regulation 13(3) or 39A(3) of the revoked Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.), in respect of a taxi stand or public light bus stand, shall be deemed to be a road marking delineated or traffic sign erected in accordance with regulation 30(2) or 29(2) of these regulations, as the case may be.

section.name: s4
section.content: A contract of hire entered into in accordance with regulation 35 of the revoked Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations shall be deemed to be a contract of hire entered into in accordance with regulation 38 of these regulations.

section.name: s5
section.content: A hire car permit issued or renewed under Part IIA of the revoked Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) shall, if the permit is valid at the commencement^ of these regulations, be deemed to be a hire car permit issued under Part III of these regulations.

section.name: s6
section.content: A bus stop designated under regulation 22 of the revoked Road Traffic (public Omnibus, Public Light Bus and Public Car) Regulations (Cap. 220 sub. leg.) shall continue to have effect as if that regulation had not been revoked.

section.name: s7
section.content: Without prejudice to any other provision of this Schedule, in so far as any application, determination or decision made or having effect as if made, direction or notice issued, given or delivered or having effect as if issued, given or delivered, condition imposed or having effect as if imposed, fee paid, exemption made, or other thing done or having effect as if done, under the revoked Road Traffic (Public Omnibus, Public Light Bus and Public Car) Regulations or Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations could have been made, issued, given, imposed, paid or done under a corresponding provision of these regulations it shall not be invalidated by the revocation effected by regulation 60 of these regulations, but shall have effect as if made, issued, given, delivered, imposed, paid or done under that corresponding provision.

def.name: Revoked
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule revoked (撤銷) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the Road Traffic (Public Omnibus, Public Light Bus and Public Car) Regulations and the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations, revoked by regulation 60 of these regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations, revoked by regulation 61 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E).

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Requirements of a Notice under Regulation 51(3)

text.leadIn: A notice referred to in regulation 51(3) shall—

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: clearly indicate to the passenger referred to in that regulation, that if he does not wear a seat belt—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: he commits an offence;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the driver of the vehicle may refuse the hire or to drive; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: he may be required to pay the fare and leave the vehicle;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: be in English and Chinese; and (L.N. 71 of 1989)

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: be of a size and a background colour and consist of such letters and characters of a size and colour so as to be easily legible and visible to a passenger referred to in regulation 51(3), and be constructed of a durable and water resistant material.

part.name: PI
part.heading: Requirements Applicable to Receipts Issued for the Purposes of Regulation 49A(1)

text.leadIn: For the purposes of regulation 49A(1), a receipt issued in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of a taxi must— (34 of 2023 s. 34)

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: be in a form from time to time specified by the Commissioner;

subsection.name: b
subsection.leadIn: subject to subparagraph (a), set out—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the registration mark of the taxi;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the date and time such hiring commences;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the date and time such hiring terminates;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the total distance travelled in the course of such hiring;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the distance for which a fare has been included by way of item 1, 2 or 2a of Schedule 5 in the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: the period of time for which a fare has been included by way of item 3 of Schedule 5 in the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.leadIn: the amount of the additional fares which have been included in the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi— (34 of 2023 s. 34)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by way of item 4 of Schedule 5; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (for a fleet taxi) as the agreed booking fee (if any); and (34 of 2023 s. 34)

paragraph.name: viii

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: consist of letters, characters and figures printed in black or blue, each of which is not less than 2 millimeters in height; and

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: be printed on paper with a white background.

part.name: PII
part.heading: Requirements Applicable to Receipts Issued for the Purposes of Regulation 49A(2)

subsection.name: a
subsection.leadIn: a receipt issued in respect of the payment of any fare for the hiring of a taxi must set out by completion in manuscript of a pre-printed form complying with the requirements of subparagraph (b)— (34 of 2023 s. 34)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the registration mark of the taxi;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the date when such hiring commences;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the time when such hiring terminates;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the amount of the fares which have been included by way of item 1, 2 or 2a and of item 3 of Schedule 5 in the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.leadIn: the amount of the additional fares which have been included in the fare recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi— (34 of 2023 s. 34)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by way of item 4 of Schedule 5; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (for a fleet taxi) as the agreed booking fee (if any); (34 of 2023 s. 34)

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: the total amount of the fares recorded in respect of such hiring on the taximeter fitted to the taxi; and

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: the name of the driver of the taxi; and

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the pre-printed form referred to in subparagraph (a) must be in a form from time to time specified by the Commissioner. (34 of 2023 s. 34)
